Articles.Content:
The last version: 0.5a4

download here ->http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/world-space-mod/

mirror here ->https://www.dropbox.com/s/xqqw1ebphb2b5xb/World_Space_05a4.zip

available rockets: Saturn-1B, Saturn V, H-IIA/B

available spacecraft: Apollo CSM, Apollo, Kyoko Sci-Fi Command Pod

World space. Rockets and spacecraft that really existed or were planned for production. The mod includes (planned for production): Saturn-5, Titan-4, Angara, H-II A/B, Zenit, Delta-4, Arian-4, Hermes, Apollo, Apollo Lunar Module, HTV, As well as the futuristic spacecraft

Like a mod? I want to spend the money? Click on a donation

albums

Javascript is disabled. View full album

version history

version 0.1
 - Added Japanese H-IIA rocket

 version 0.2
 - Changed the texture format with mbm to png
 - Added the first stage of the Japanese H-IIB rocket
 - Change the texture of the first stage H-IIA
 - Changing patterns and textures of the second stage H-II
 - At the second stage of the H-II added RCS engines
 - Changed the characteristics of the first-stage H-IIA
 - Changed the characteristics of the second stage stage H-II
 - Changed the texture of the SRB-A
 - Added TTU Castor 4AXL
 - Added 3 new aerodynamic fairing
 - Added a Japanese flag

 version 0.3
 - Changed the characteristics of the first-stage H-IIA and H-IIB
 - Added Saturn-V rocket

 version 0.4a0
 - Adapted to the version 0.22
 - Changed the characteristics Saturn V rocket
 - Added Mercury space ship (test version)
 - Added USRM solid booster (test version)
 - Added Titan IV first stage (test version)
 - Added Atlas D (old version)

version 0.5a0
 - Adapted to the version 0.23
 - Changed the characteristics Saturn V rocket
 - Added Apollon spacecraft
 - Added Saturn-1B rocket

version 0.5a1
 - Added Glonass M Solar Panel
 - Changed the characteristics Apollon spacecraft
 - Changed the 3d model rocket Saturn-1B First Stage 
 - Changed the characteristics rocket Saturn-1B 

version 0.5a2
 - Changed the 3d model rocket Saturn-5 Therd Stage 
 - Changed texture rocket Saturn-5 Therd Stage 
 - Changed the characteristics Saturn V rocket
 - Changed the characteristics rocket Saturn-1B
 - Changed the characteristics Glonass M Solar Panel

version 0.5a3
 - Changed the 3d model decupler Saturn-1b second Stage 
 - Changed the characteristics Saturn V rocket
 - Changed the characteristics rocket Saturn-1B
 - Deleted the Atlas rocket
 - Deleted the Mercury spacecraft
 - Deleted the Titan rocket

version 0.5a4
 - Added railings Apollo POD
 - Fix Problem upheaval POD at splashdown
 - Added Japan Sci-Fi Command module Kyoko
 - Added Mercury space ship

Thank you so much testers: Reddragon and czokletmuss

License

Edited March 10, 2014 by Lovad
Lol wow, nice models. So you have two rockets now, and plan on making more, or am I misreading?

Lol wow, nice models. So you have two rockets now, and plan on making more, or am I misreading?

Now there's only Saturn 5 and HII A/B pack plan to increase with time is now to develop Titan IV rocket
Heh, the nose on that Saturn 5 seems a bit odd, but I like the look of things!

camacha

Saturn 5 I was initially planned to use it for output heavy constructions in orbit, and then for the Apollo missions. This has contributed to a strange nose cone. Now Saturn 5 easy throws to the orbit of 100 km. load of 90 tons. But with classical line-up missions to Saturn Apollo and Skaylab too will be.

Edited October 3, 2013 by Lovad
When are you planning to work on the Apollo crafts? The Saturn V works well and surprisingly stable. The slow ascent is also realistic.
Looks great, but please add a license for your work as per forum rules.

Looks great, but please add a license for your work as per forum rules.

Thanks! Done!

Saturn 5 I was initially planned to use it for output heavy constructions in orbit, and then for the Apollo missions.

So the Saturn included in this pack is more like a Saturn INT-21 (the one that was used for Skylab).

IMHO a great idea. I've got lots of work for this one. There is always some station-part to be hauled...

Anyway, I'll give it a try and add it to my 'wartchlist', as the planned launchers and crafts look very promising.
All those rockets....Looks like a great mod!

i have a question why did u steal textures from http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/japanese-launch-vehicles-pack/

your h2 is praticaly the same textures from what i can tell

I would imagine that if a real-life rocket looks a particular way, all accurate portrayals of it will appear identical enough to seem the same.

Do you have any concrete evidence that they're stolen, or are you simply going on the fact that they look the same?

i have a question why did u steal textures from http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/japanese-launch-vehicles-pack/

your h2 is praticaly the same textures from what i can tell

Whats he supposed to do, paint it purple?
I use the JPLV pack, its H-II is much organgey darker metalic. I'll post a comparison pic in a few hours of the two

I would imagine that if a real-life rocket looks a particular way, all accurate portrayals of it will appear identical enough to seem the same.

Do you have any concrete evidence that they're stolen, or are you simply going on the fact that they look the same?

Definitely not the same. I just downloaded both packs. They don't look the same at all in the VAB and I even converted a few of the mbm textures from one to to compare to the other and they're just not even close, other than having been based off the same rocket. Someone owes someone else an apology.
I agree - if they are not the same, sidfu should apologize to lovad for his accusation, and to the rest of us for stirring up the thread.

I agree - if they are not the same, sidfu should apologize to lovad for his accusation, and to the rest of us for stirring up the thread.

Seriously. I have fond memories of a time, not so long ago, in which this forum was virtually devoid of asses. *le sniff*

As well as the futuristic spacecraft

Falcon X or XX from SpaceX maybe? I would love to launch interplanetary missions with these rockets if you are taking suggestions.

Falcon X or XX from SpaceX maybe? I would love to launch interplanetary missions with these rockets if you are taking suggestions.

SLS anyone? Would be fun.
Very good model of Saturn V, I'm loving it

When are you planning to work on the Apollo crafts? The Saturn V works well and surprisingly stable. The slow ascent is also realistic.

In Work

So the Saturn included in this pack is more like a Saturn INT-21 (the one that was used for Skylab).

IMHO a great idea. I've got lots of work for this one. There is always some station-part to be hauled...

Anyway, I'll give it a try and add it to my 'wartchlist', as the planned launchers and crafts look very promising.

Saturn is still under development. plans must be put into orbit 140 tons. But I do not to understand why more is enough for me 90 tons.

All those rockets....Looks like a great mod!

Thanks!

i have a question why did u steal textures from http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/japanese-...vehicles-pack/

your h2 is praticaly the same textures from what i can tell

Did not you notice the texture different? If you think that I stole texture ansur_nied is your right. I began to develop a mod in May. And the first version of the mod has been published on the website kerbalspace.ru (link) it was made June 30, 2013

I agree - if they are not the same, sidfu should apologize to lovad for his accusation, and to the rest of us for stirring up the thread.

Can not apologize. I'm not offended.

Falcon X or XX from SpaceX maybe? I would love to launch interplanetary missions with these rockets if you are taking suggestions.

so these missiles is someone has done or am I mistaken ?

so these missiles is someone has done or am I mistaken ?

No, the only Space X mods are Falcon 1 and 9 from the KERBX mod and the same two with Falcon Heavy from the LazTek mod. Falcon X and XX are just concept future designs of super heavy launch vehicles of Space X.
So your did use ansur's textures? I'm confused.
Falcon XX looks amazing

DarthVader: NO. The whole last few pages established that, and the author just said that while thinking they might have stolen the textures is your right, they started making the rocket before the other one was released.
